summary: Sir Charles Spry was associated with the Australian Security Intelligence Organization (ASIO). He is mentioned in the context of recommending against the declassification of Warren Commission document CD-971. This document relates to an investigation of anonymous telephone calls made to the Canberra Embassy both before and after President Kennedy's assassination. The documents suggest that Spry's recommendation was based on concerns related to this investigation, and the CIA ultimately followed his recommendation against declassification.
significance: Sir Charles Spry's significance in the JFK context lies in his role in influencing the decision to keep Warren Commission document CD-971 classified. His recommendation, stemming from his position within ASIO, highlights the international dimensions of the JFK assassination investigation and the concerns surrounding the information contained within the classified documents.
